messages.subject: Mail Exchange
messages.msgSnippet: Hello everyone, If you like to have some geography fun. There is a group called mail exchange http://groups.yahoo.com/group/MailExchange/?yguid=93349703 where
messages.messageBody:
Hello everyone,

If you like to have some geography fun. There is a group called
mail exchange
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/MailExchange/?yguid=93349703

where children are exchanging post cards with each other. Please
come and participate maybe your child can collect all 50 states.

messages.subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mail Exchange
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Hazel, just a quick thankyou for the mention on the mail exchange. What a great idea! I just signed up :) Cleopatra/J ... From: hazy_lilly Sent: Thursday,
messages.messageBody:
Hi Hazel, just a quick thankyou for the mention on the mail
exchange.
What a great idea! I just signed up :)
Cleopatra/J
----- Original Message -----
From: hazy_lilly
Sent: Thursday, March 14, 2002 6:23 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mail Exchange

Hello ,
I just started an egroup to exchange postcard. I haven't
meet a
child that does not enjoy recieving mail. I figure this
would be a
fun way to teach them geograpy. I have only contacted a few

unschooling groups so far, but I am hoping to contact all
5o states.
Please come and participate. There are other mail exchange
groups
that cost money this will only cost a post card and postage
and
little bit of your child's time to say hello Im am in which
ever
state he or she is from. This will be fun for all ages (
including
the 2 and 3 yeard olds.)
Thank you
Hazel
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/MailExchange/



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mail Exchange
messages.msgSnippet: HI LISA, Hi just click on the url below and join.  If you put the state in the subject. In the message you might want to put your email address.  This way you
messages.messageBody:
HI LISA,

Hi just click on the url below and join. If you put
the state in the subject. In the message you might
want to put your email address. This way you can
exchange addresses privately. Feel free to click on
the messages and ask if they like to exchange. Fell
free to chat in there as well.

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/MailExchange

hazel
--- Lisa Kim <kidtherapist@...> wrote:
> Hi Hazel. I'd like to participate with my kids. We
> are in Coralville, Iowa (near Iowa City.) My
> children are 5 and 6 years old. Please let me know
> what you need from us.
>
> Thanks,
> Lisa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mail Exchange
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Hazel.  I d like to participate with my kids.  We are in Coralville, Iowa (near Iowa City.)  My children are 5 and 6 years old.  Please let me know what you
messages.messageBody:
Hi Hazel. I'd like to participate with my kids. We are in Coralville, Iowa (near Iowa City.) My children are 5 and 6 years old. Please let me know what you need from us.

Thanks,
Lisa

----- Original Message -----
From: hazy_lilly
Sent: Thursday, March 14, 2002 6:23 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Mail Exchange

Hello ,
I just started an egroup to exchange postcard. I haven't meet a
child that does not enjoy recieving mail. I figure this would be a
fun way to teach them geograpy. I have only contacted a few
unschooling groups so far, but I am hoping to contact all 5o states.
Please come and participate. There are other mail exchange groups
that cost money this will only cost a post card and postage and
little bit of your child's time to say hello Im am in which ever
state he or she is from. This will be fun for all ages ( including
the 2 and 3 yeard olds.)

Thank you
Hazel
